definitions.definition: To reduce in width or extent ; to contract .
examples: We need to narrow the search.

definitions.definition: To partially lower one's eyelids in a way usually taken to suggest a defensive, aggressive or penetrating look.
examples: He stepped in front of me, narrowing his eyes to slits.
She wagged her finger in his face, and her eyes narrowed .

definitions.definition: To contract the size of, as a stocking, by taking two stitches into one.
To convert to a data type that cannot hold as many distinct values.
examples: to narrow an int variable to a short variable

main_definition: ( transitive ) To reduce in width or extent ; to contract .
secondary_definitions: ( of a person or eyes ) To partially lower one's eyelids in a way usually taken to suggest a defensive, aggressive or penetrating look.
( knitting ) To contract the size of, as a stocking, by taking two stitches into one.
( transitive , programming ) To convert to a data type that cannot hold as many distinct values.
